selected_quotes: The social taboo against women making more money than their husbands is hurting the institution of marriage
One of the nicest papers I have recently read: how men cannot handle women earning more than them
Toujours sur ces histoires d'égalité salariale au sein des couples hétérosexuels mariés, c'est vraiment passionnant
Tant qu'on y est, un rappel que les histoires d'égalité salariale ne dépendent pas que d'un choix des employeurs
Is a couple more likely to #divorce if the wife earns more than the husband? Read the research

blogs.title: How a hackneyed romantic ideal is used to stigmatise polyamory
blogs.summary: There’s no longer anything unusual about wanting an open relationship. Many who consider themselves progressive about sex, gender, love and relationships know this. It’s just that almost nobody in an open relationship wants to be open about it.

news.title: Does a Woman’s High-Status Career Hurt Her Marriage? Not If Her Husband Does the Laundry
news.summary: Executive Summary In the U.S., women were the primary breadwinners in 18% of marriages in 1987, but rose to 29% in dual-income marriages by 2014.

news.title: Does a Woman’s High-Status Career Hurt Her Marriage? Not If Her Husband Does the Laundry
news.summary: While women who win the Academy Award for Best Actress are celebrated for reaching a pinnacle of career achievement, several of them also share another distinction – divorce.

source.name: World Bank
source.description: The World Bank is a United Nations international financial institution that provides loans to developing countries for capital programs. The World Bank is a component of the World Bank Group, and a member of the United Nations Development Group. The World Bank's mission is to end extreme poverty within a generation and boost shared prosperity.
